title: Danila Maroz
text:
Postdoctoral Researcher Amazon, SCOT Topline Science Team New York, NY




Email | CV | Research







I am a Postdoctoral Researcher at Amazon, developing macroeconomic forecasting models and conducting causal analysis using state space models for supply chain optimization.


I received my PhD in Economics from Harvard University in 2024, specializing in Macroeconomics and Econometrics. My advisors were James H. Stock, Anna Mikusheva, and Gabriel Chodorow-Reich.





My research focuses on developing and applying econometric methods in macroeconomic contexts, particularly in data-rich environments. I work with:



State space models (Bayesian and frequentist)
Causal inference methods
Time series econometrics
Macroeconomic forecasting






At Amazon, my work includes:



Development of state space forecasting models for topline metrics
Causal macroeconomic analysis (presented at Consumer Science Summit)
Policy analysis: tariffs, prices, and uncertainty effects
AI-assisted research workflows






PhD in Economics | Harvard University | 2024 MSc in Economics and Social Sciences | Bocconi University | 2018 BA in Economics and Business | LUISS University | 2015

title: About
text:
I’m an economist and researcher working at the intersection of macroeconomics, econometrics, and machine learning.
Beyond research, I enjoy:

Chess - strong amateur player
Tennis - NTRP 3.5 level
Kitesurfing & Waterskiing - former professional athlete
Writing - essays and prose
